poem:
Morning Headlines  

A cup of coffee warms my hand,  
ink smudged, nations scrambled;  
a voice rises—a claim, a fire,  
obliteration wrapped in morning glow.  
  
In the paper's fold, a world recast,  
as sunlight paints the breakfast table—  
words of power scatter like crumbs,  
caught in the breeze of a new day.
